elements.description: The html element represents the root of an HTML document.
The head element represents a collection of metadata for the Document.

The title element represents the document's title or name. Authors should use titles that identify their documents even when they are used out of context, for example in a user's history or bookmarks, or in search results. The document's title is often different from its first heading, since the first heading does not have to stand alone when taken out of context.

The base element allows authors to specify the document base URL for the purposes of parsing URLs, and the name of the default navigable for the purposes of following hyperlinks. The element does not represent any content beyond this information.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Document base URL

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Default navigable for hyperlink navigation and form submission

elements.description: The link element allows authors to link their document to other resources.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Address of the hyperlink

attributes.name: crossorigin
attributes.description: How the element handles crossorigin requests

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: Relationship between the document containing the hyperlink and the destination resource

attributes.name: media
attributes.description: Applicable media

attributes.name: integrity
attributes.description: Integrity metadata used in Subresource Integrity checks [SRI]

attributes.name: hreflang
attributes.description: Language of the linked resource

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Hint for the type of the referenced resource

attributes.name: referrerpolicy
attributes.description: Referrer policy for fetches initiated by the element

attributes.name: sizes
attributes.description: Sizes of the icons (for rel="icon")

attributes.name: imagesrcset
attributes.description: Images to use in different situations, e.g., high-resolution displays, small monitors, etc. (for rel="preload")

attributes.name: imagesizes
attributes.description: Image sizes for different page layouts (for rel="preload")

attributes.name: as
attributes.description: Potential destination for a preload request (for rel="preload" and rel="modulepreload")

attributes.name: blocking
attributes.description: Whether the element is potentially render-blocking

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: Color to use when customizing a site's icon (for rel="mask-icon")

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the link is disabled

attributes.name: fetchpriority
attributes.description: Sets the priority for fetches initiated by the element

elements.description: The meta element represents various kinds of metadata that cannot be expressed using the title, base, link, style, and script elements.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Metadata name

attributes.name: http-equiv
attributes.description: Pragma directive

attributes.name: content
attributes.description: Value of the element

attributes.name: charset
attributes.description: Character encoding declaration

attributes.name: media
attributes.description: Applicable media

elements.description: The style element allows authors to embed CSS style sheets in their documents. The style element is one of several inputs to the styling processing model. The element does not represent content for the user.

attributes.name: media
attributes.description: Applicable media

attributes.name: blocking
attributes.description: Whether the element is potentially render-blocking

elements.description: The body element represents the contents of the document.

The article element represents a complete, or self-contained, composition in a document, page, application, or site and that is, in principle, independently distributable or reusable, e.g. in syndication. This could be a forum post, a magazine or newspaper article, a blog entry, a user-submitted comment, an interactive widget or gadget, or any other independent item of content.
The section element represents a generic section of a document or application. A section, in this context, is a thematic grouping of content, typically with a heading.
The nav element represents a section of a page that links to other pages or to parts within the page: a section with navigation links.

The aside element represents a section of a page that consists of content that is tangentially related to the content around the aside element, and which could be considered separate from that content. Such sections are often represented as sidebars in printed typography.
These elements represent headings for their sections.

The hgroup element represents a heading and related content. The element may be used to group an h1–h6 element with one or more p elements containing content representing a subheading, alternative title, or tagline.
The header element represents a group of introductory or navigational aids.

The footer element represents a footer for its nearest ancestor sectioning content element, or for the body element if there is no such ancestor. A footer typically contains information about its section such as who wrote it, links to related documents, copyright data, and the like.
The address element represents the contact information for its nearest article or body element ancestor. If that is the body element, then the contact information applies to the document as a whole.
The p element represents a paragraph.

The hr element represents a paragraph-level thematic break, e.g., a scene change in a story, or a transition to another topic within a section of a reference book; alternatively, it represents a separator between a set of options of a select element.
The pre element represents a block of preformatted text, in which structure is represented by typographic conventions rather than by elements.
The blockquote element represents a section that is quoted from another source.

attributes.name: cite
attributes.description: Content inside a blockquote must be quoted from another source, whose address, if it has one, may be cited in the cite attribute.

elements.description: The ol element represents a list of items, where the items have been intentionally ordered, such that changing the order would change the meaning of the document.

attributes.name: reversed
attributes.description: Number the list backwards

attributes.name: start
attributes.description: The start attribute, if present, must be a valid integer. It is used to determine the starting value of the list.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type attribute can be used to specify the kind of marker to use in the list, in the cases where that matters (e.g. because items are to be referenced by their number/letter).

elements.description: The ul element represents a list of items, where the order of the items is not important — that is, where changing the order would not materially change the meaning of the document.

The menu element represents a toolbar consisting of its contents, in the form of an unordered list of items (represented by li elements), each of which represents a command that the user can perform or activate.

The li element represents a list item. If its parent element is an ol, ul, or menu element, then the element is an item of the parent element's list, as defined for those elements. Otherwise, the list item has no defined list-related relationship to any other li element.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: If the element is not a child of an ul or menu element: value — Ordinal value of the list item

elements.description: The dl element represents an association list consisting of zero or more name-value groups (a description list). A name-value group consists of one or more names (dt elements, possibly as children of a div element child) followed by one or more values (dd elements, possibly as children of a div element child), ignoring any nodes other than dt and dd element children, and dt and dd elements that are children of div element children. Within a single dl element, there should not be more than one dt element for each name.
The dt element represents the term, or name, part of a term-description group in a description list (dl element).
The dd element represents the description, definition, or value, part of a term-description group in a description list (dl element).

The figure element represents some flow content, optionally with a caption, that is self-contained (like a complete sentence) and is typically referenced as a single unit from the main flow of the document.
The figcaption element represents a caption or legend for the rest of the contents of the figcaption element's parent figure element, if any.
The main element represents the dominant contents of the document.

The search element represents a part of a document or application that contains a set of form controls or other content related to performing a search or filtering operation. This could be a search of the web site or application; a way of searching or filtering search results on the current web page; or a global or Internet-wide search function.

The div element has no special meaning at all. It represents its children. It can be used with the class, lang, and title attributes to mark up semantics common to a group of consecutive elements. It can also be used in a dl element, wrapping groups of dt and dd elements.
If the a element has an href attribute, then it represents a hyperlink (a hypertext anchor) labeled by its contents.

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Address of the hyperlink

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Navigable for hyperlink navigation

attributes.name: download
attributes.description: Whether to download the resource instead of navigating to it, and its filename if so

attributes.name: ping
attributes.description: URLs to ping

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: Relationship between the location in the document containing the hyperlink and the destination resource

attributes.name: hreflang
attributes.description: Language of the linked resource

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Hint for the type of the referenced resource

attributes.name: referrerpolicy
attributes.description: Referrer policy for fetches initiated by the element

elements.description: The em element represents stress emphasis of its contents.
The strong element represents strong importance, seriousness, or urgency for its contents.
The small element represents side comments such as small print.
The s element represents contents that are no longer accurate or no longer relevant.

The cite element represents the title of a work (e.g. a book, a paper, an essay, a poem, a score, a song, a script, a film, a TV show, a game, a sculpture, a painting, a theatre production, a play, an opera, a musical, an exhibition, a legal case report, a computer program,  etc.). This can be a work that is being quoted or referenced in detail (i.e., a citation), or it can just be a work that is mentioned in passing.
The q element represents some phrasing content quoted from another source.

attributes.name: cite
attributes.description: Link to the source of the quotation or more information about the edit

elements.description: The dfn element represents the defining instance of a term. The paragraph, description list group, or section that is the nearest ancestor of the dfn element must also contain the definition(s) for the term given by the dfn element.

The abbr element represents an abbreviation or acronym, optionally with its expansion. The title attribute may be used to provide an expansion of the abbreviation. The attribute, if specified, must contain an expansion of the abbreviation, and nothing else.

The ruby element allows one or more spans of phrasing content to be marked with ruby annotations. Ruby annotations are short runs of text presented alongside base text, primarily used in East Asian typography as a guide for pronunciation or to include other annotations. In Japanese, this form of typography is also known as furigana.

The rt element marks the ruby text component of a ruby annotation. When it is the child of a ruby element, it doesn't represent anything itself, but the ruby element uses it as part of determining what it represents.
The rp element can be used to provide parentheses or other content around a ruby text component of a ruby annotation, to be shown by user agents that don't support ruby annotations.
The data element represents its contents, along with a machine-readable form of those contents in the value attribute.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Machine-readable value

elements.description: The time element represents its contents, along with a machine-readable form of those contents in the datetime attribute. The kind of content is limited to various kinds of dates, times, time-zone offsets, and durations, as described below.

attributes.name: datetime
attributes.description: Machine-readable value

elements.description: The code element represents a fragment of computer code. This could be an XML element name, a filename, a computer program, or any other string that a computer would recognize.

The var element represents a variable. This could be an actual variable in a mathematical expression or programming context, an identifier representing a constant, a symbol identifying a physical quantity, a function parameter, or just be a term used as a placeholder in prose.
The samp element represents sample or quoted output from another program or computing system.
The kbd element represents user input (typically keyboard input, although it may also be used to represent other input, such as voice commands).
The sup element represents a superscript and the sub element represents a subscript.

The i element represents a span of text in an alternate voice or mood, or otherwise offset from the normal prose in a manner indicating a different quality of text, such as a taxonomic designation, a technical term, an idiomatic phrase from another language, transliteration, a thought, or a ship name in Western texts.

The b element represents a span of text to which attention is being drawn for utilitarian purposes without conveying any extra importance and with no implication of an alternate voice or mood, such as key words in a document abstract, product names in a review, actionable words in interactive text-driven software, or an article lede.

The u element represents a span of text with an unarticulated, though explicitly rendered, non-textual annotation, such as labeling the text as being a proper name in Chinese text (a Chinese proper name mark), or labeling the text as being misspelt.

The mark element represents a run of text in one document marked or highlighted for reference purposes, due to its relevance in another context. When used in a quotation or other block of text referred to from the prose, it indicates a highlight that was not originally present but which has been added to bring the reader's attention to a part of the text that might not have been considered important by the original author when the block was originally written, but which is now under previously unexpected scrutiny. When used in the main prose of a document, it indicates a part of the document that has been highlighted due to its likely relevance to the user's current activity.
The bdi element represents a span of text that is to be isolated from its surroundings for the purposes of bidirectional text formatting. [BIDI]

The bdo element represents explicit text directionality formatting control for its children. It allows authors to override the Unicode bidirectional algorithm by explicitly specifying a direction override. [BIDI]
The span element doesn't mean anything on its own, but can be useful when used together with the global attributes, e.g. class, lang, or dir. It represents its children.
The br element represents a line break.
The wbr element represents a line break opportunity.
The ins element represents an addition to the document.

attributes.name: cite
attributes.description: Link to the source of the quotation or more information about the edit

attributes.name: datetime
attributes.description: Date and (optionally) time of the change

elements.description: The del element represents a removal from the document.

attributes.name: cite
attributes.description: Link to the source of the quotation or more information about the edit

attributes.name: datetime
attributes.description: Date and (optionally) time of the change

elements.description: The picture element is a container which provides multiple sources to its contained img element to allow authors to declaratively control or give hints to the user agent about which image resource to use, based on the screen pixel density, viewport size, image format, and other factors. It represents its children.
The source element allows authors to specify multiple alternative source sets for img elements or multiple alternative media resources for media elements. It does not represent anything on its own.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of embedded resource

attributes.name: media
attributes.description: Applicable media

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: srcset
attributes.description: Images to use in different situations, e.g., high-resolution displays, small monitors, etc.

attributes.name: sizes
attributes.description: Image sizes for different page layouts

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Horizontal dimension

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Vertical dimension

elements.description: An img element represents an image.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: Replacement text for use when images are not available

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: srcset
attributes.description: Images to use in different situations, e.g., high-resolution displays, small monitors, etc.

attributes.name: sizes
attributes.description: Image sizes for different page layouts

attributes.name: crossorigin
attributes.description: How the element handles crossorigin requests

attributes.name: usemap
attributes.description: Name of image map to use

attributes.name: ismap
attributes.description: Whether the image is a server-side image map

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Horizontal dimension

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Vertical dimension

attributes.name: referrerpolicy
attributes.description: Referrer policy for fetches initiated by the element

attributes.name: decoding
attributes.description: Decoding hint to use when processing this image for presentation

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Used when determining loading deferral

attributes.name: fetchpriority
attributes.description: Sets the priority for fetches initiated by the element

elements.description: The iframe element represents its content navigable.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: srcdoc
attributes.description: A document to render in the iframe

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of content navigable

attributes.name: sandbox
attributes.description: Security rules for nested content

attributes.name: allow
attributes.description: Permissions policy to be applied to the iframe's contents

attributes.name: allowfullscreen
attributes.description: Whether to allow the iframe's contents to use requestFullscreen()

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Horizontal dimension

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Vertical dimension

attributes.name: referrerpolicy
attributes.description: Referrer policy for fetches initiated by the element

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Used when determining loading deferral

elements.description: The embed element provides an integration point for an external application or interactive content.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of embedded resource

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Horizontal dimension

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Vertical dimension

elements.description: The object element can represent an external resource, which, depending on the type of the resource, will either be treated as an image or as a child navigable.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of embedded resource

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of content navigable

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the element with a form element

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Horizontal dimension

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Vertical dimension

elements.description: A video element is used for playing videos or movies, and audio files with captions.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: crossorigin
attributes.description: How the element handles crossorigin requests

attributes.name: poster
attributes.description: Poster frame to show prior to video playback

attributes.name: preload
attributes.description: Hints how much buffering the media resource will likely need

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: Hint that the media resource can be started automatically when the page is loaded

attributes.name: playsinline
attributes.description: Encourage the user agent to display video content within the element's playback area

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: Whether to loop the media resource

attributes.name: muted
attributes.description: Whether to mute the media resource by default

attributes.name: controls
attributes.description: Show user agent controls

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Horizontal dimension

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Vertical dimension

elements.description: An audio element represents a sound or audio stream.

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: crossorigin
attributes.description: How the element handles crossorigin requests

attributes.name: preload
attributes.description: Hints how much buffering the media resource will likely need

attributes.name: autoplay
attributes.description: Hint that the media resource can be started automatically when the page is loaded

attributes.name: playsinline
attributes.description: Encourage the user agent to display video content within the element's playback area

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: Whether to loop the media resource

attributes.name: muted
attributes.description: Whether to mute the media resource by default

attributes.name: controls
attributes.description: Show user agent controls

elements.description: The track element allows authors to specify explicit external timed text tracks for media elements. It does not represent anything on its own.

attributes.name: kind
attributes.description: The type of text track

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: srclang
attributes.description: Language of the text track

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: User-visible label

attributes.name: default
attributes.description: Enable the track if no other text track is more suitable

elements.description: The map element, in conjunction with an img element and any area element descendants, defines an image map. The element represents its children.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of image map to reference from the usemap attribute

elements.description: The area element represents either a hyperlink with some text and a corresponding area on an image map, or a dead area on an image map.

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: Replacement text for use when images are not available

attributes.name: coords
attributes.description: Coordinates for the shape to be created in an image map

attributes.name: shape
attributes.description: The kind of shape to be created in an image map

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: Address of the hyperlink

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Navigable for hyperlink navigation

attributes.name: download
attributes.description: Whether to download the resource instead of navigating to it, and its filename if so

attributes.name: ping
attributes.description: URLs to ping

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: Relationship between the location in the document containing the hyperlink and the destination resource

attributes.name: referrerpolicy
attributes.description: Referrer policy for fetches initiated by the element

elements.description: The table element represents data with more than one dimension, in the form of a table.
The caption element represents the title of the table that is its parent, if it has a parent and that is a table element.
The colgroup element represents a group of one or more columns in the table that is its parent, if it has a parent and that is a table element.

attributes.name: span
attributes.description: Number of columns spanned by the element where the number is > 0 && <= 1000

elements.description: If a col element has a parent and that is a colgroup element that itself has a parent that is a table element, then the col element represents one or more columns in the column group represented by that colgroup.

attributes.name: span
attributes.description: Number of columns spanned by the element where the number is > 0 && <= 1000

elements.description: The tbody element represents a block of rows that consist of a body of data for the parent table element, if the tbody element has a parent and it is a table.

The thead element represents the block of rows that consist of the column labels (headers) and any ancillary non-header cells for the parent table element, if the thead element has a parent and it is a table.
The tfoot element represents the block of rows that consist of the column summaries (footers) for the parent table element, if the tfoot element has a parent and it is a table.
The tr element represents a row of cells in a table.
The td element represents a data cell in a table.

attributes.name: span
attributes.description: Number of columns spanned by the element where the number is > 0 && <= 1000

attributes.name: rowspan
attributes.description: Number of rows that the cell is to span where the number is > 0 && <= 65534

attributes.name: headers
attributes.description: The header cells for this cell

elements.description: The th element represents a header cell in a table.

attributes.name: span
attributes.description: Number of columns spanned by the element where the number is > 0 && <= 1000

attributes.name: rowspan
attributes.description: Number of rows that the cell is to span where the number is > 0 && <= 65534

attributes.name: headers
attributes.description: The header cells for this cell

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description: Specifies which cells the header cell applies to

attributes.name: abbr
attributes.description: Alternative label to use for the header cell when referencing the cell in other contexts

elements.description: The form element represents a hyperlink that can be manipulated through a collection of form-associated elements, some of which can represent editable values that can be submitted to a server for processing.

attributes.name: accept-charset
attributes.description: Character encodings to use for form submission

attributes.name: action
attributes.description: URL to use for form submission

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Default setting for autofill feature for controls in the form

attributes.name: enctype
attributes.description: Entry list encoding type to use for form submission

attributes.name: method
attributes.description: Variant to use for form submission

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of form to use in the document.forms API

attributes.name: novalidate
attributes.description: Bypass form control validation for form submission

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: Navigable for form submission

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: The rel attribute on form elements controls what kinds of links the elements create.

elements.description: The label element represents a caption in a user interface. The caption can be associated with a specific form control, known as the label element's labeled control, either using the for attribute, or by putting the form control inside the label element itself.

attributes.name: for
attributes.description: Associate the label with form control

elements.description: The input element represents a typed data field, usually with a form control to allow the user to edit the data.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: Hint for expected file type in file upload controls

attributes.name: alpha
attributes.description: Allow the color's alpha component to be set

attributes.name: alt
attributes.description: Replacement text for use when images are not available

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Hint for form autofill feature

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: Hint for form autofill feature

attributes.name: colorspace
attributes.description: The color space of the serialized color

attributes.name: dirname
attributes.description: Name of form control to use for sending the element's directionality in form submission

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the form control is disabled

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the element with a form element

attributes.name: formaction
attributes.description: URL to use for form submission

attributes.name: formenctype
attributes.description: Entry list encoding type to use for form submission

attributes.name: formmethod
attributes.description: Variant to use for form submission

attributes.name: formnovalidate
attributes.description: Bypass form control validation for form submission

attributes.name: formtarget
attributes.description: Navigable for form submission

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Vertical dimension

attributes.name: list
attributes.description: List of autocomplete options

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: Maximum value

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Maximum length of value

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: Minimum value

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: Minimum length of value

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Whether to allow multiple values

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the element to use for form submission and in the form.elements API

attributes.name: pattern
attributes.description: Pattern to be matched by the form control's value

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: User-visible label to be placed within the form control

attributes.name: popovertarget
attributes.description: Targets a popover element to toggle, show, or hide

attributes.name: popovertargetaction
attributes.description: Indicates whether a targeted popover element is to be toggled, shown, or hidden

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Whether to allow the value to be edited by the user

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Whether the control is required for form submission

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the control

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: Granularity to be matched by the form control's value

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of form control

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value of the form control

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Horizontal dimension

elements.description: The button element represents a button labeled by its contents.

attributes.name: command
attributes.description: Indicates to the targeted element which action to take.

attributes.name: commandfor
attributes.description: Targets another element to be invoked.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the form control is disabled

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the element with a form element

attributes.name: formaction
attributes.description: URL to use for form submission

attributes.name: formenctype
attributes.description: Entry list encoding type to use for form submission

attributes.name: formmethod
attributes.description: Variant to use for form submission

attributes.name: formnovalidate
attributes.description: Bypass form control validation for form submission

attributes.name: formtarget
attributes.description: Navigable for form submission

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the element to use for form submission and in the form.elements API

attributes.name: popovertarget
attributes.description: Targets a popover element to toggle, show, or hide

attributes.name: popovertargetaction
attributes.description: Indicates whether a targeted popover element is to be toggled, shown, or hidden

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of button

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value to be used for form submission

elements.description: The select element represents a control for selecting amongst a set of options.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Hint for form autofill feature

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the form control is disabled

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the element with a form element

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: Whether to allow multiple values

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the element to use for form submission and in the form.elements API

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Whether the control is required for form submission

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: Size of the control

elements.description: The datalist element represents a set of option elements that represent predefined options for other controls. In the rendering, the datalist element represents nothing and it, along with its children, should be hidden.
The optgroup element represents a group of option elements with a common label.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the form control is disabled

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: User-visible label

elements.description: The option element represents an option in a select element or as part of a list of suggestions in a datalist element.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the form control is disabled

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: User-visible label

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description: Whether the option is selected by default

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Value to be used for form submission

elements.description: The textarea element represents a multiline plain text edit control for the element's raw value. The contents of the control represent the control's default value.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Hint for form autofill feature

attributes.name: cols
attributes.description: Maximum number of characters per line

attributes.name: dirname
attributes.description: Name of form control to use for sending the element's directionality in form submission

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the form control is disabled

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the element with a form element

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Maximum length of value

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: Minimum length of value

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the element to use for form submission and in the form.elements API

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: User-visible label to be placed within the form control

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Whether to allow the value to be edited by the user

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Whether the control is required for form submission

attributes.name: rows
attributes.description: Number of lines to show

attributes.name: wrap
attributes.description: How the value of the form control is to be wrapped for form submission

elements.description: The output element represents the result of a calculation performed by the application, or the result of a user action.

attributes.name: for
attributes.description: Specifies controls from which the output was calculated

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the element with a form element

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the element to use in the form.elements API.

elements.description: The progress element represents the completion progress of a task. The progress is either indeterminate, indicating that progress is being made but that it is not clear how much more work remains to be done before the task is complete (e.g. because the task is waiting for a remote host to respond), or the progress is a number in the range zero to a maximum, giving the fraction of work that has so far been completed.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Current value of the element

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: Upper bound of range

elements.description: The meter element represents a scalar measurement within a known range, or a fractional value; for example disk usage, the relevance of a query result, or the fraction of a voting population to have selected a particular candidate.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Current value of the element

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: Lower bound of range

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: Upper bound of range

attributes.name: low
attributes.description: High limit of low range

attributes.name: high
attributes.description: Low limit of high range

attributes.name: optimum
attributes.description: Optimum value in gauge

elements.description: The fieldset element represents a set of form controls (or other content) grouped together, optionally with a caption. The caption is given by the first legend element that is a child of the fieldset element, if any. The remainder of the descendants form the group.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Whether the descendant form controls, except any inside legend, are disabled

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: Associates the element with a form element

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the element to use in the form.elements API.

elements.description: The legend element represents a caption for the rest of the contents of the legend element's parent fieldset element, if any. Otherwise, if the legend has a parent optgroup element, then the legend represents the optgroup's label.

The selectedcontent element reflects the contents of a select element's currently selected option element. selectedcontent elements can be used to declaratively show the selected option element's contents within the select element's first child button element.
The details element represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of group of mutually-exclusive details elements

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Whether the details are visible

elements.description: The summary element represents a summary, caption, or legend for the rest of the contents of the summary element's parent details element, if any.

The dialog element represents a transitory part of an application, in the form of a small window ("dialog box"), which the user interacts with to perform a task or gather information. Once the user is done, the dialog can be automatically closed by the application, or manually closed by the user.

attributes.name: closedby
attributes.description: Which user actions will close the dialog

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Whether the dialog box is showing

elements.description: The script element allows authors to include dynamic script, instructions to the user agent, and data blocks in their documents. The element does not represent content for the user.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: Type of script

attributes.name: src
attributes.description: Address of the resource

attributes.name: nomodule
attributes.description: Prevents execution in user agents that support module scripts

attributes.name: async
attributes.description: Execute script when available, without blocking while fetching

attributes.name: defer
attributes.description: Defer script execution

attributes.name: blocking
attributes.description: Whether the element is potentially render-blocking

attributes.name: crossorigin
attributes.description: How the element handles crossorigin requests

attributes.name: referrerpolicy
attributes.description: Referrer policy for fetches initiated by the element

attributes.name: integrity
attributes.description: Integrity metadata used in Subresource Integrity checks [SRI]

attributes.name: fetchpriority
attributes.description: Sets the priority for fetches initiated by the element

elements.description: The noscript element represents nothing if scripting is enabled, and represents its children if scripting is disabled. It is used to present different markup to user agents that support scripting and those that don't support scripting, by affecting how the document is parsed.
The template element is used to declare fragments of HTML that can be cloned and inserted in the document by script.

attributes.name: shadowrootmode
attributes.description: Enables streaming declarative shadow roots

attributes.name: shadowrootdelegatefocus
attributes.description: Sets delegates focus on a declarative shadow root

attributes.name: shadowrootclonable
attributes.description: Sets clonable on a declarative shadow root

attributes.name: shadowrootserializable
attributes.description: Sets serializable on a declarative shadow root

attributes.name: shadowrootcustomelementregistry
attributes.description: Enables declarative shadow roots to indicate they will use a custom element registry

elements.description: The slot element defines a slot. It is typically used in a shadow tree. A slot element represents its assigned nodes, if any, and its contents otherwise.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of shadow tree slot

elements.description: The canvas element provides scripts with a resolution-dependent bitmap canvas, which can be used for rendering graphs, game graphics, art, or other visual images on the fly.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Horizontal dimension

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Vertical dimension

elements.description: These elements represent headings for their sections.
These elements represent headings for their sections.
These elements represent headings for their sections.
These elements represent headings for their sections.
These elements represent headings for their sections.

attributes.name: accesskey
attributes.description: The accesskey attribute's value is used by the user agent as a guide for creating a keyboard shortcut that activates or focuses the element.

attributes.name: autocapitalize
attributes.description: The autocapitalize attribute is an enumerated attribute whose states are the possible autocapitalization hints. The autocapitalization hint specified by the attribute's state combines with other considerations to form the used autocapitalization hint, which informs the behavior of the user agent.

attributes.name: autocorrect
attributes.description: The autocorrect attribute can be used on an editing host to control autocorrection behavior for the hosted editable region, on an input or textarea element to control the behavior when inserting text into that element, or on a form element to control the default behavior for all autocapitalize-and-autocorrect inheriting elements associated with the form element.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: The autofocus content attribute allows the author to indicate that an element is to be focused as soon as the page is loaded, allowing the user to just start typing without having to manually focus the main element.

attributes.name: class
attributes.description: When specified on HTML elements, the class attribute must have a value that is a set of space-separated tokens representing the various classes that the element belongs to.

attributes.name: data
attributes.description: A custom data attribute is an attribute in no namespace whose name starts with the string "data-", has at least one character after the hyphen, is a valid attribute local name, and contains no ASCII upper alphas.

attributes.name: draggable
attributes.description: All HTML elements may have the draggable content attribute set.

attributes.name: enterkeyhint
attributes.description: The enterkeyhint content attribute is an enumerated attribute that specifies what action label (or icon) to present for the enter key on virtual keyboards. This allows authors to customize the presentation of the enter key in order to make it more helpful for users.

attributes.name: hidden
attributes.description: All HTML elements may have the hidden content attribute set.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: The id attribute specifies its element's unique identifier (ID).

attributes.name: inert
attributes.description: The inert attribute is a boolean attribute that indicates, by its presence, that the element and all its flat tree descendants which don't otherwise escape inertness (such as modal dialogs) are to be made inert by the user agent.

attributes.name: inputmode
attributes.description: User agents can support the inputmode attribute on form controls (such as the value of textarea elements), or in elements in an editing host (e.g., using contenteditable).

attributes.name: itemid
attributes.description: The itemid attribute, if specified, must have a value that is a valid URL potentially surrounded by spaces.

attributes.name: itemprop
attributes.description: The itemprop attribute, if specified, must have a value that is an unordered set of unique space-separated tokens none of which are identical to another token, representing the names of the name-value pairs that it adds. The attribute's value must have at least one token.

attributes.name: itemref
attributes.description: The itemref attribute, if specified, must have a value that is an unordered set of unique space-separated tokens none of which are identical to another token and consisting of IDs of elements in the same tree.

attributes.name: itemscope
attributes.description: Every HTML element may have an itemscope attribute specified. The itemscope attribute is a boolean attribute.

attributes.name: itemtype
attributes.description: The itemtype attribute, if specified, must have a value that is an unordered set of unique space-separated tokens, none of which are identical to another token and each of which is a valid URL string that is an absolute URL, and all of which are defined to use the same vocabulary. The attribute's value must have at least one token.

attributes.name: lang
attributes.description: The lang attribute (in no namespace) specifies the primary language for the element's contents and for any of the element's attributes that contain text. Its value must be a valid BCP 47 language tag, or the empty string. Setting the attribute to the empty string indicates that the primary language is unknown.

attributes.name: nonce
attributes.description: A nonce content attribute represents a cryptographic nonce ("number used once") which can be used by Content Security Policy to determine whether or not a given fetch will be allowed to proceed. The value is text.

attributes.name: popover
attributes.description: All HTML elements may have the popover content attribute set. When specified, the element won't be rendered until it becomes shown, at which point it will be rendered on top of other page content.

attributes.name: slot
attributes.description: The slot attribute is used to assign a slot to an element: an element with a slot attribute is assigned to the slot created by the slot element whose name attribute's value matches that slot attribute's value — but only if that slot element finds itself in the shadow tree whose root's host has the corresponding slot attribute value.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: User agents can support the checking of spelling and grammar of editable text, either in form controls (such as the value of textarea elements), or in elements in an editing host (e.g. using contenteditable).

attributes.name: style
attributes.description: All HTML elements may have the style content attribute set. This is a style attribute as defined by CSS Style Attributes.

attributes.name: tabindex
attributes.description: The tabindex attribute, if specified, must have a value that is a valid integer. Positive numbers specify the relative position of the element's focusable areas in the sequential focus navigation order, and negative numbers indicate that the control is not sequentially focusable.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The title attribute represents advisory information for the element, such as would be appropriate for a tooltip. On a link, this could be the title or a description of the target resource; on an image, it could be the image credit or a description of the image; on a paragraph, it could be a footnote or commentary on the text; on a citation, it could be further information about the source; on interactive content, it could be a label for, or instructions for, use of the element; and so forth. The value is text.

attributes.name: translate
attributes.description: The translate attribute is used to specify whether an element's attribute values and the values of its Text node children are to be translated when the page is localized, or whether to leave them unchanged.

attributes.name: writingsuggestions
attributes.description: User agents offer writing suggestions as users type into editable regions, either in form controls (e.g., the textarea element) or in elements in an editing host.
